alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hard Freeze Warning issued December 23 at 1:03AM CST until December 23 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...HARD FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 11 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...HARD FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Hard Freeze Warning this morning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 23 expected. For the Hard Freeze Warning tonight, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 15 expected. For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * WHERE...Coffee, Dale and Geneva Counties. * WHEN...For the first Hard Freeze Warning, from 4 AM to 11 AM CST this morning. For the second Hard Freeze Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon to 10 AM CST Sunday. For the Wind Advisory, until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained winds of 26 to 39 mph are expected for at least 2 hours, or gusts between 40 to 57 mph for any length of time are possible.Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
